tooltip.body: See all the items you've copied to the Clipboard.
Pick a paste option, such as keeping formatting or pasting only content.
Add content on the Clipboard to your document.
Remove the selection and put it on the Clipboard so you can paste it somewhere else.
Pick how you want to copy the selection.
Put a copy of the selection on the Clipboard so you can paste it somewhere else.
Put a copy of the selection on the Clipboard so you can paste it somewhere else.

Like the look of a particular selection? You can apply that look to other content in the document.

To get started:
1. Select content with the formatting you like
2. Click Format Painter
3. Select something else to automatically apply the formatting

FYI: To apply the formatting in multiple places, double-click Format Painter.
Pick a new font for your text.

item.text: Gill Sans MT Ext Condensed Bold

tooltip.body: Change the size of your text.
Make your text a bit bigger.
Make your text a bit smaller.
Make your text bold.
Italicize your text.
Underline your text.
Underline your text.
Bottom Border
Apply borders to the currently selected cells.
Color the background of cells to make them stand out.
Color the background of cells to make them stand out.
Change the color of your text.
Change the color of your text.

Customize your text to give it the exact look you want.

You can add a variety of styles and colors to your text, as well as visual effects such as strikethrough and superscript.

Don't see what you're looking for?

Check out the full set of cell alignment options.
Align text to the top.
Align text so that it is centered between the top and bottom of the cell.
Align text to the bottom.
Align your content to the left.
Center your content.
Align your content to the right.
Rotate your text diagonally or vertically. This is a great way to label narrow columns.

Don't see what you're looking for?

Check out the full set of cell alignment options.
Move your content closer to the cell border.
Move your content farther away from the cell border.
Wrap extra-long text into multiple lines so you can see all of it.

Combine and center the contents of the selected cells in a new larger cell.

This is a great way to create a label that spans multiple columns.
Pick how to merge cells.

Combine and center the contents of the selected cells in a new larger cell.

This is a great way to create a label that spans multiple columns.
Merge selected cells in the same row into one large cell.
Merge the selected cells into one cell.
Split the current cell into multiple cells.

Don't see what you're looking for?

Check out the full set of number formatting options.
Choose the format for your cells, such as percentage, currency, date or time.
Format as Dollars, Euros, or other currency.
Format as Dollars, Euros, or other currency.
Format as a percent.
Format with a thousands separator.
Show more decimal places for a more precise value.
Show fewer decimal places.

Add new cells, rows or columns to your workbook.

FYI: To insert multiple rows or columns at a time, select multiple rows or columns in the sheet, and click Insert.
Add cells, rows, columns or sheets to your workbook.

Delete cells, rows, columns or sheets from your workbook.

FYI: To delete multiple rows or columns at a time, select multiple rows or columns in the sheet, and click Delete.

Delete cells, rows, columns or sheets from your workbook.

FYI: To delete multiple rows or columns at a time, select multiple rows or columns in the sheet, and click Delete.
